fqTitle: Will Kenya report over 100 confirmed mpox cases by July, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if Kenya officially reports more than 100 confirmed mpox cases by July 31, 2024. If the reported number is 100 or fewer, or if no clear report is available by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

The resolution time is measured from the moment Microsoft officially acknowledges the outage to when they declare the issue fully resolved and services restored. The cut must be officially announced and implemented by the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC). This question does not consider the magnitude of the cut, only whether a cut occurs.

The inflation measure must be one that is widely recognized as a preferred gauge by economic authorities. The 2% threshold refers to the year-over-year inflation rate. The three-month period must be continuous and uninterrupted.

Fully operational means that all lines are open and running at their normal capacity without any disruptions related to the arson attacks. The question resolves as NO if any part of the high-speed rail network remains closed or is operating at reduced capacity due to the attacks by the resolution date.

The hurricane must maintain Category 5 intensity at the time of landfall. Landfall is defined as the center of the storm crossing the coastline. The Caribbean region includes all islands in the Caribbean Sea and the coastal areas of Central America and northern South America bordering the Caribbean Sea.

'Affects' is defined as the hurricane's center passing within 100 nautical miles of any part of Jamaica while at Category 4 or 5 intensity. The hurricane does not need to make direct landfall on Jamaica to qualify. Official reports from the U.S. National Hurricane Center or the Jamaican Meteorological Service will be used to determine the hurricane's category and proximity to Jamaica.

fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, all five individuals charged in a case involving an alleged attempt to bribe a juror in Minnesota have entered not guilty pleas. The case involves a conspiracy to offer $120,000 in cash for the acquittal of defendants in a COVID-19-related fraud case. As of the question's creation, two individuals have already pleaded not guilty. The question resolves as NO if any of the five charged individuals enter a guilty plea or if the case is resolved through other means before the resolution date.

fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one individual is convicted in connection with an alleged attempt to bribe a juror in Minnesota with $120,000 for the acquittal of defendants in a COVID-19-related fraud case. The conviction must be directly related to the bribery attempt, not for unrelated charges. If no convictions are secured by the resolution date, or if all charges are dropped or dismissed, the question resolves as NO.
